author: a_a
post_text: January 15, 2019 at 7:16 AM#1Hey, I have 2 consoles in session and FTP server connected to it. Is it possible to create a macro that saves the current show to the ftp server, regardless of which console the macro is activated? The ftp backup tab is only visible on the master console, but it would be convenient to be able to backup to server also from the slave console.If I start the slave console up first, making it master before the other takes over, the server tab will be visible on both desks, but sometimes both consoles freeze during server backup, demanding a restart, and I am guessing this happens because I backup to server from the slave console, even though the server shouldn't be visible from the slave console.Is there any way to solve this problem - for example creating a macro that always tells the master desk to run the macro, even if the macro is pressed on the backup console?

posts.post_text: January 15, 2019 at 10:55 AM#2Hey!You could use remote command.CodeRemoteCommand 192.168.0.1 "Macro x"The IP adress has to be the adress of your masterconsole and x is the number of your macro.Or you could assign a sequence with a dummy cue to an EcecButton and writeCodeMacro "Name of your Macro"in the command line of the cue.Commands in the commandline of a cue are executed by the master console.I am not sure if there is a way to work with RemoteCommand and a macro name beacause of the "quotation marks inside quotation marks problem".
